business.headline: Gold and silver at record highs. Should investors buy now or wait?Gold and silver prices are trading near record highs after a powerful rally this year. With both metals delivering strong returns, many investors are now wondering whether it still makes sense to buy or wait for a correction.

December 15 advance tax deadline is here: Who must pay and what happens if you don'tThe third advance tax instalment is due today, December 15. For many taxpayers, missing this deadline could mean mandatory interest and a larger payment at the time of filing returns.

Claimed tax refunds using fake donations? Here's what income tax department is doingIf you claimed tax benefits by showing donations that were never made, the Income Tax Department may already be watching. Authorities have launched a fresh drive to identify and correct such false claims.

4-day work week under new labour codes? Here's what Labour Ministry clarifiedOn November 21, 2025, the government replaced 29 old labour laws with four new Labour Codes and can Indians really work only four days a week and still get paid for a full week?

Hindustan Zinc shares may climb to Rs 660. Here's why Jefferies is bullishAccording to brokerage firm Jefferies, the Rs 660 target price suggests a potential upside of around 22%, including a dividend yield of about 4%.
Sensex opens 200 points lower, Nifty below 26,000; NTPC down 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 394.84 points to 84,872.82, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 129.75 points to 25,917.20 as of 9:29 am.

Want to save tax? Here's how gifting mutual funds can help you with itA lesser-known method is gaining attention, gifting mutual fund units to relatives to legally reduce, or in some cases completely avoid, tax on capital gains.

Park Medi World IPO: Check allotment status as GMP falls to its lowestPark Medi World IPO closed with an overall subscription of 8.52 times, showing steady demand across categories even as premium expectations cooled.

New labour codes: Will variable pay change your salary, PF and gratuity?Will your take-home salary change under the new labour codes, and what will higher variable pay mean for your PF and gratuity in the long run? Let's understand.

Goa fire tragedy: From compensation to insurance, what victims can claimThe Uphaar cinema fire in Delhi, the Kumbakonam school blaze, the Mumbai Kamala Mills fire, the Surat coaching centre tragedy, each incident left behind not just casualties, but families pushed into years of legal battles simply to secure basic compensation.

Johnson & Johnson ordered to pay $40 million to 2 women in talc powder caseThe verdict comes as the company faces tens of thousands of similar lawsuits nationwide and after its latest attempt to resolve the litigation through bankruptcy was rejected by US courts.

How is young India really spending money? Hint: It's not gadgets and clothesYoung Indians' spending habits are shifting quickly, and it's no longer about gadgets or new outfits. Here's a closer look at where their money is actually going.

Cabinet clears 100% FDI in insurance: What the new bill means for the sectorThe government says the changes are designed to offer stronger protection to policyholders and bring more players into the market. This could lead to better products, faster claim settlements, and improved customer service.

Aroon Purie rings NSE bell, says it's for next chapter of India, India Today GroupIndia Today Group Chairman and Editor-in-Chief Aroon Purie on Friday rang the closing bell at the National Stock Exchange (NSE) to mark the Group's 50-year journey and said it was for the next chapter of India and the India Today Group.

NSE bell we ring today is for next chapter of India, India Today Group: Aroon PurieThe moment symbolised both a milestone for the media group and a nod to India's financial markets, which have grown alongside the Group's own evolution since 1975.

Video: NSE felicitates India Today Group Chairman Aroon Purie on 50-year milestoneNational Stock Exchange (NSE) MD & CEO Ashish Kumar Chauhan on Friday felicitated India Today Group Chairman Aroon Purie as the Group completed 50 years at a ceremony in Mumbai.

Retail inflation rises to 0.71% in November from 0.25% in OctoberFood inflation remained in deflation for the sixth straight month, but the pace of decline narrowed sharply. The Consumer Food Price Index showed a contraction of 3.91% in November, compared to a much steeper 5.02% fall in October.

Silver prices cross Rs 2 lakh milestone: Is there more upside left?Silver has been on a strong upward streak over the past month, supported by a softer US dollar, falling global interest rates and renewed buying in industrial commodities.
Video: India Today Chairman Aroon Purie rings NSE bell to mark ITG's 50 yearsIndia Today Group Chairman and Editor-in-Chief Aroon Purie rang the NSE bell on Friday to mark the Group's 50 years.
Sensex ends 450 points higher, Nifty above 26,000; Tata Steel up 3%Sensex ends 450 points higher, Nifty above 26,000; Tata Steel up 3%

entertainment.headline: Why My Hero Academia still stands out in a crowded superhero landscape In this week's Animania, we dive into My Hero Academia's quirky world of heroes, chaos, and heart, to take a fun look at how the anime blends action, humour, and surprisingly human storytelling.

George Clooney to end on-screen romance, says he no longer will be kissing girls George Clooney, 63, is shifting his career after consulting his wife, deciding to forgo romantic roles with younger co-stars and will no longer be "kissing girls" in movies. Following Paul Newman's path, the actor is stepping aside for the next generation of leading men.

Bigg Boss Telugu 9 enters finale week: Top 5 locked, Bharani eliminated The journey to the trophy officially began as Bigg Boss Telugu 9 stepped into its finale week, with host Nagarjuna announcing the prize money, confirming the Top 5 contestants.

Daughter Soundarya watches Rajinikanth's Padayappa with fans, calls film an emotion Soundarya Rajinikanth watched Padayappa's 25th anniversary re-release with fans in Chennai. The event celebrated Rajinikanth's 75th birthday and sparked widespread fan excitement.

Ranveer Singh drops cryptic 'kismat' note as Dhurandhar dominates box office Ranveer Singh shares a cryptic Instagram post reflecting on fate, patience and faith. The message comes as his film Dhurandhar enjoys a massive box office run.

Parag Tyagi's poignant love letter marks Shefali Jariwala's 43rd birth anniversary Parag Tyagi shared a moving Instagram post to mark the birth anniversary of his late wife, Shefali Jariwala, who died in June. The tribute coincided with his mother's birthday.

Bob Reiner's son Nick under investigation in parents' deaths, probe underway Rob Reiner and his wife, Michele Singer Reiner, were discovered dead in their Brentwood residence in California on December 14. Various media sources indicated that their son, Nick Reiner, is being questioned in connection with the deaths.

Amitabh Bachchan shoots three KBC episodes a day at 83, says Sharib Hashmi Sharib Hashmi shared that Amitabh Bachchan shoots up to three episodes of Kaun Banega Crorepati in a single day, starting at 9 am and wrapping up close to midnight, even at 83. The actor praised Bachchan's unmatched energy and discipline after appearing on KBC 17.

Sohail Khan apologises after viral video shows him riding without helmet Sohail Khan apologised after a video of him riding a bike without a helmet in Bandra went viral and drew criticism online. The actor admitted his mistake, cited claustrophobia as the reason, and urged all riders to follow traffic rules and wear helmets for safety.

Actor Dileep excluded from Kerala temple coupon inauguration after rising protests Actor Dileep was removed from Ernakulam Shiva Temple coupon distribution inauguration following objections from the temple committee and the Cochin Devaswom Board. This comes days after the actor was acquitted in the 2017 Malayalam actor assault case.

Bigg Boss Kannada 12: Rakshitha and Dhruvanth exit the house, but not the show Bigg Boss Kannada 12 delivered a shock to fans with a double eviction, as Rakshitha and Dhruvanth left the house. But there was a twist about the eviction, as Kichcha Sudeep later revealed.

Dhurandhar box office rampage: 7 destructive records set by Ranveer Singh's film Dhurandhar is rewriting the rules of the Bollywood box office in 2025. The non-festive release is outperforming big-ticket holiday films and creating new records almost every day.

Messi GOAT India tour: Shahid Kapoor, Shilpa Shetty's kids meet football legend Lionel Messi's GOAT India Tour in Mumbai created memorable moments for countless fans, including Bollywood stars and their families. Shahid Kapoor and Shilpa Shetty also met the football legend at Wankhede Stadium along with their respective kids.

When Dharmendra's shot nearly hit Big B on Sholay set: Ramesh Sippy recalls Sholay director Ramesh Sippy recalled a tense moment from the film's climax when Dharmendra accidentally fired a loaded gun and the bullet narrowly missed Amitabh Bachchan. The incident was resolved after the shoot was halted, highlighting the risks behind filming the iconic classic.

Bigg Boss Tamil 9: Ramya-Viyana evicted, Vijay Sethupathi roasts Pavarthy, Kamrudin Double eviction week saw Ramya Joo and Viyana leaving Bigg Boss Tamil 9 while Vijay Sethupathi reprimanded housemates over rule violations and addressed FJ's actions in the Aadhirai case.

Taylor Swift plays aunt to Travis Kelce's nieces after Chiefs' playoff exit Pop sensation Taylor Swift was captured spending time with Travis Kelce's nieces during the Kansas City Chiefs' recent defeat, which ended the team's run in the NFL playoffs for the first time since 2014.

Lahore 1947: Ali Fazal wraps up his final schedule for Aamir Khan's production Actor Ali Fazal has wrapped up his final shoot for the much-awaited film 'Lahore 1947'. The period drama explores India's partition and boasts an ensemble cast, including Sunny Deol, Preity Zinta, and Shabana Azmi.

Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar records houseful shows in Kashmir's Shopian, Pulwama Dhurandhar has recorded houseful shows in smaller Jammu and Kashmir towns. The film's success highlights growing demand for affordable cinema in underscreened regions.

Amy Schumer, Chris Fischer part ways after 7 years, focus on co-parenting Details emerge about the factors behind Amy Schumer and Chris Fischer's recent divorce, highlighting the impact of career ambitions and parenting on their relationship, according to sources close to the couple.

general news.headline: Government likely to repeal MGNREGA, bring new rural employment law: SourcesThe government circulated the Bill, which aims to "establish a rural development framework aligned with the national vision of Viksit Bharat @2047", was circulated among the members of the Lok Sabha on Monday.

With 84 conditions, TVK's Vijay gets permission for December 18 rallyPolice on Sunday granted permission for TVK chief Vijay's public meeting in Erode on December 18 after the HR&CE department issued a No Objection Certificate. Organisers must follow 84 conditions and deposit Rs 50,000.

2 dead in huge vehicle pile-up on Delhi-Mumbai Expressway amid dense fogDense fog reduced visibility to near zero in Haryana's Nuh district, triggering multiple crashes on the Delhi–Mumbai Expressway and nearby roads. Dozens of vehicles were also damaged in accidents.

How IndiGo crisis reveals a bigger Air India tragedyWhile lakhs of Indians suffered due to the IndiGo fiasco, not many thought of Air India as the Maharaja in a shining armour that could come to their rescue. Air India, which sucked in much-loved Vistara, is trying to find its feet with a refurbished fleet. But decades of bad memories aren't overwritten easily. This is the very moment Air India can step up and reclaim lost ground.

Ranveer Singh drops cryptic 'kismat' note as Dhurandhar dominates box officeRanveer Singh shares a cryptic Instagram post reflecting on fate, patience and faith. The message comes as his film Dhurandhar enjoys a massive box office run.

Live: India extends condolences to Australia after Bondi beach terror attackSydney Bondi Beach Shooting Live Updates: Australia is reeling from its deadliest gun attack in nearly three decades after a targeted antisemitic shooting at Sydney's Bondi Beach left many dead. Police have identified one of the gunmen as a 50-year-old man who was shot dead at the scene, while the suspected second shooter, his 24-year-old son, remains in critical condition in hospital. An ISIS flag was found in a car linked to the suspects, intensifying terrorism concerns. Authorities raided the family's home in Sydney's Bonnyrigg suburb as the investigation widened. Forty people, including two police officers, remain hospitalised, with victims ranging in age from 10 to 87. Stay with IndiaToday.com for live updates –

Messi in India Live: Messi arrives in Delhi after delay due to fogMessi in India, GOAT tour Day 3 live updates: The Argentine football icon has arrived in New Delhi as the capital battles severe fog and alarming air pollution levels. The conditions have shaped preparations around Messi's final stop in India.

Congress expels Odisha leader who challenged party's leadership to Sonia GandhiMohammed Moquim's expulsion came days after he wrote a scathing letter to former Congress president Sonia Gandhi, flagging leadership failures and a widening disconnect between the party and its workers.

Nuclear device lost in the Himalayas 60 years ago threatens Ganga todayIn 1965, at the height of Cold War anxieties over China's nascent nuclear programme, the CIA and India's Intelligence Bureau launched a covert mission to install a nuclear‑powered listening device high on Nanda Devi. Then the weather turned.

4-day work week under new labour codes? Here's what Labour Ministry clarifiedOn November 21, 2025, the government replaced 29 old labour laws with four new Labour Codes and can Indians really work only four days a week and still get paid for a full week?

68 flights cancelled, 60 trains delayed due to fog; Messi's Delhi leg hit tooNear-zero visibility from dense fog combined with severe air pollution disrupted road traffic and delayed early morning flights in Delhi. An orange alert has also been issued by the weather department.

Keep Your Little Ones Cozy This Winter with Amazon Everyday EssentialsWhether you're looking to care for little ones or find the perfect gift, this collection of baby and kids' essentials brings together nourishment, comfort, and thoughtful design.

Why Yunus admin is dialing India for a pre-election shooting in BangladeshDays after the attack on anti-India and anti-Sheikh Hasina radical leader Sharif Osman Hadi, the Yunus administration has sought India's help to arrest and hand over the shooters. This comes even as the Dhaka Metropolitan Police said there was no verified evidence the assailants crossed into India. Delhi, meanwhile, urged Dhaka to ensure law and order as there has been an uptick in violence with the election approaching.

Went for a swim, will eat now: Sydney shooter called mother hours before attackTwenty-four-year-old Naveed Akram is accused of joining his father in a mass shooting at a Hanukkah event on Sydney's Bondi Beach that left 15 people, including a child, dead. He is currently in police custody.

Hollywood director Rob Reiner, wife found dead at LA home, cops probe as homicideRob Reiner is known for films such as A Few Good Men, When Harry Met Sally... and The Princess Bride. The couple was reportedly stabbed and the deaths are being probed as homicide.

Bondi Beach shooting: Ahmed al Ahmed's valour proves courage is the true religionIn Sydney's Bondi Beach horror, Syrian fruit seller Ahmed al Ahmed sprinted toward gunfire to disarm a gunman targeting Jews. His four-second act shattered divisions of faith and nation, proving courage is humanity's true religion.

India Today @ 50 Part 1: Revisiting India's most turbulent decadeIndia Today Group marks its 50th anniversary with a five-part docu-series reflecting on its impactful journey in Indian journalism. The series revisits pivotal moments from 1975 to 1985, highlighting political and cultural shifts that shaped the nation.

Bondi shooting, many failures: Australia let off IS shooter, cops froze amid firingThe massacre of 15 people at Sydney's Bondi Beach, where a father-son duo opened fire at people celebrating a Jewish festival, exposes deep flaws in Australia's intelligence and police systems. From the Australian intelligence giving a clean chit to shooter Naveed Akram in 2019 to ignoring antisemitism, and then cops freezing for 20 minutes as the killers rained death, the Bondi shooting has exposed systemic failures.

Actor Dileep excluded from Kerala temple coupon inauguration after rising protestsActor Dileep was removed from Ernakulam Shiva Temple coupon distribution inauguration following objections from the temple committee and the Cochin Devaswom Board. This comes days after the actor was acquitted in the 2017 Malayalam actor assault case.

Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar records houseful shows in Kashmir's Shopian, PulwamaDhurandhar has recorded houseful shows in smaller Jammu and Kashmir towns. The film's success highlights growing demand for affordable cinema in underscreened regions.

George Clooney to end on-screen romance, says he no longer will be kissing girlsGeorge Clooney, 63, is shifting his career after consulting his wife, deciding to forgo romantic roles with younger co-stars and will no longer be "kissing girls" in movies. Following Paul Newman's path, the actor is stepping aside for the next generation of leading men.

Irawati Karve, India's first female anthropologist, who disproved Nazi race theoryIrawati Karve (1905–1970) was India's first female anthropologist, a fearless scholar who challenged Nazi racial science in Berlin and redefined caste and kinship in India. Author of 'Yuganta', she bridged myth and modernity, proving that one woman's intellect and courage could dismantle entrenched ideologies and inspire generations.

Luthra brothers to return to Delhi tomorrow week after fleeing to Thailand: SourcesThe Luthra brothers are set to arrive in Delhi and will be taken into custody by Goa Police for further investigation. Legal proceedings are underway as the case develops.

Delhi cafe blasted online for employee appreciation post resembling condolence noteA congratulatory social media post by Wongdhen Cafe in Delhi has been criticised after users mistook its design for a condolence message.

sports.headline: With the Ashes on the line, England's Harry Brook accepts he must curb aggression The Ashes 2025-26: Speaking ahead of the third Test in Adelaide, England's Harry Brook admitted that his shot-selection in his first tour Down Under have not been ideal and said that he has to cut down on his aggression while batting.

Shafali Verma named ICC Women's Player of the Month after World Cup heist Shafali Verma was named ICC Women's Player of the Month for November 2025 after a match-winning all-round performance in India's World Cup final triumph over South Africa.

Keep this shot in cold storage: Sunil Gavaskar's blunt advice to Suryakumar Former India captain Sunil Gavaskar was blunt in his assessment, urging Suryakumar Yadav to put his pick-up shot in "cold storage" until he finds the right moment to bring it back.

PSL 2026 to start on March 26, confirms PCB chief, again set to clash with IPL The PCB has confirmed that PSL 11 will run from March 26 to May 3, overlapping with the IPL, prompting schedule adjustments, a January 8 auction for two new franchises, and paving the way for an eight-team league in 2026.

Who is Deepesh Devendran? Dale Steyn fan wrecks Pakistan in U19 Asia Cup Deepesh Devendran continued his rapid rise by ripping through Pakistan with 3/16 in the U19 Asia Cup clash on Sunday in Dubai, underlining his emergence as India's standout fast-bowling prospect.

Desperate England rope in 6'4" speedster for must-win Adelaide Test England recalled Josh Tongue for the must-win third Ashes Test in Adelaide, backing the in-form pacer while retaining Ollie Pope and Will Jacks as they look to end a long winless run in Australia.

PM Modi congratulates Indian squash team on historic maiden World Cup win Prime Minister Narendra Modi praised the Indian squash team for their historic maiden Squash World Cup title, saying that the title triumph has made the entire nation proud.

IPL 2026 auction: Six uncapped stars franchises could target IPL 2026 auction: Uncapped stars to watch – explosive batters, versatile all-rounders and promising young bowlers who could become breakout sensations or bargain buys for franchises

Messi in India Live: Messi arrives in Delhi after delay due to fog Messi in India, GOAT tour Day 3 live updates: The Argentine football icon has arrived in New Delhi as the capital battles severe fog and alarming air pollution levels. The conditions have shaped preparations around Messi's final stop in India.

New Zealand pacer Blair Tickner set to miss white-ball tour of India Blair Tickner is likely to miss New Zealand's five-match ODI and three-match T20I series in India, beginning on January 11, after dislocating his shoulder during the second Test against the West Indies.

'Are your lungs insured Messi?' Fans prepare to welcome GOAT in smoggy Delhi As Lionel Messi nears to his arrival in fog-hit New Delhi, fans chose humour over chaos. Memes flooded social media, capturing the capital's weather, pollution and anticipation around the football icon's final India stop.

Australia captain Pat Cummins calls for blood donations after Bondi Beach attackAustralian cricket team captain Pat Cummins has issued an urgent appeal for blood donations following Sunday's deadly attack at Bondi Beach, which claimed 16 lives and left dozens injured.

Messi in New Delhi: Traffic police set new rules to avoid a Kolkata-like messDelhi authorities have moved early to prevent crowd chaos as Lionel Messi's India tour reaches its final stop. After the Kolkata fallout, tighter traffic planning aims to ensure smoother movement and safer fan access.

Ashes: England coach issues clarification over viral 'overprepared' statementEngland head coach Brendon McCullum said his post-Brisbane "overprepared" comment was meant to protect the dressing room and that internal messages can sound different in public.

A 14-year-old at the door: Why Vaibhav Suryavanshi feels ready for India debutAt an age when most are still learning the game, Vaibhav Suryavanshi is forcing Indian cricket to confront an uncomfortable question: when talent arrives this early, can patience afford to wait?

IPL 2026 auction strategy explained: 5 players SRH can targetIPL Auction: SunRisers Hyderabad finished 6th in the last edition of the IPL. The team will be looking out for a specialist finisher and a couple of strong spin bowling options.

Shubman, Suryakumar will win matches for India at T20 World Cup: AbhishekIndia opener Abhishek Sharma has thrown his weight behind senior batters Suryakumar Yadav and Shubman Gill ahead of the ICC Men's T20 World Cup, expressing confidence that the duo will come good when it matters most.

Suryakumar Yadav and the unending search for formSuryakumar Yadav is now without a T20I fifty for 21 innings. When will his yearning for runs end? Can India afford out of form capyain and vice captain going into the T20 World Cup?

A 10/10 evening: When Mumbai wrapped Lionel Messi and Sachin Tendulkar in loveMessi GOAT Tour in Mumbai: It was the fans who defined the night, as Mumbai poured its love on Lionel Messi and Sachin Tendulkar, creating a 10/10 moment driven by emotion, respect and shared admiration.

Xabi Alonso makes relationship with Vinicius Jr clear: Real Madrid is very unitedXabi Alonso shut down talk of unrest with a simple gesture. His hug with Vinícius Jr after substitution underlined Real Madrid's unity during their 2-1 La Liga win over Deportivo Alaves.

Bondi beach shooting: Michael Vaughan narrowly escapes attackFormer England cricketer Michael Vaughan narrowly survived the Bondi beach attack on Sunday. Two shooters opened fire in public, killing at least 11 and injuring close to 30.

Mumbai's message to Kolkata: Messi-merising evening with real GOAT crowdThe city of Mumbai turned up in numbers to get a glimpse of Lionel Messi at the Wankhede Stadium. The event went smoothly, and produced several memorable moments, prompting the Maharashtra CM to tweet that Mumbai has the GOAT fans.

Arshdeep makes the ball talk in Dharamsala, dedicates POTM award to 10-year-old nieceArshdeep Singh bounced back strongly in Dharamsala, using swing and seam to outthink South Africa before dedicating his Player of the Match award to his 10-month-old niece.

Arshdeep, Varun combine as India blow away South Africa in DharamsalaIND vs SA: India completed yet another thumping win against South Africa in the 5-match T20I series. The bowling unit, led by Arshdeep Singh and Varun Chakravarthy blew away the Proteas in Dharamsala.

India wins maiden squash world cup with 3-0 victory over Hong KongIndia won its first-ever Squash World Cup title with a dominant 3-0 win over Hong Kong in Chennai. The historic victory marks a new high for Indian squash and could become a watershed moment for the sport in the country.

Varun Chakaravarthy spins magic in Dharamsala, 2nd fastest Indian to 50 T20I wicketsIND vs SA, 3rd T20I: Varun Chakaravarthy delivered a clinical performance in Dharamsala, rattling South Africa's middle order and becoming the second-fastest Indian to reach 50 T20I wickets.

IND vs SA: All-round Hardik Pandya scripts history with 100 T20I wicketsIND vs SA: Hardik Pandya reached the landmark of 100 T20I wickets in the Dharamsala T20I, thereby becoming the fifth cricketer in Men's T20Is to achieve the feat. He also became the third Indian in Men's T20Is with 100 wickets.

Messi, Sachin, Chhetri: GOATs meet at Wankhede to create epic moments in MumbaiLionel Messi's GOAT tour moment saw some epic moments in Mumbai's Wankhede Stadium. The legendary Argentine meet the very best of Indian sports - Sachin Tendulkar and Sunil Chhetri and exchanged jerseys.

Bumrah misses Dharamsala T20I due to personal reasons, returns to MumbaiIndia vs South Africa, 3rd T20I: Jasprit Bumrah was unavailable for selection on Sunday due to personal reasons. The fast bowler flew to Mumbai and could miss the last two matches of the series.

Unstoppable India crush Pakistan to continue flawless run in U19 Asia CupIndia U19 extended their unbeaten run in the U19 Asia Cup with a commanding 90-run win over Pakistan in Dubai on Sunday, posting 240 and restricting their rivals to 150.

Messi's Kolkata Visit Turns Chaotic: Fans Allege Mismanagement, Vandalise Salt Lake StadiumIn this Special Report, an Unidentified speaker reports from Kolkata's Yuva Bharati Krirangan on the chaotic scenes during Lionel Messi's visit. The reporter highlights 'total mismanagement' as fans, angry over Messi's brief 'eight to nine minutes' appearance, vandalised the stadium. The transcript details how spectators threw bottles and set fire to seats meant for VVIPs, including Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee. Despite the presence of superstars Rodrigo De Paul and Luis Suarez, the event descended into a 'ruckus' with allegations of poor visibility and cancelled interactions.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
